intro: Oenothera mutabilis, commonly known as the evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening and close by dawn. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branching. The seeds of Oenothera mutabilis are enclosed in a capsule that splits open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind.
